column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/jason-licht-and-lavonte-david/|Jason Licht And Lavonte David|This week at the combine in Indianapolis
column2: Bucs AC/DC-loving general manager Jason Licht made it crystal clear he and the Bucs would love to have franchise icon Lavonte David back at linebacker. But Licht also noted he and Todd Bowles must look out for the good of the franchise. They can’t just ignore linebacker with the hope that David returns. How the Bucs plan to address linebacker
column4: is unclear. But both Licht and Bowles noted that inside linebacker is a focus of their research monitoring prospects in  interviews and workouts. Joe
column6: has mentioned that Combine Week is also the illegal tampering period. Agents are thick as flies in downtown Indianapolis and it is very common to see them wandering the hallways of the Indiana Convention Center
column8: as well as the nighttime haunts and eateries that dot downtown. So it is virtually impossible for a team executive not to cross paths with agents unless the guy never leaves his hotel room. In fact
column9: the framework of trades and future signings are often established this week. (For example
column11: his theft of Jason Pierre-Paul from the Giants
column12: had its seeds planted at the 2018 combine). Per NFL insider Josina Anderson
column13: Licht met with David’s agent this week and Anderson learned Licht told David’s agent to take his time making a decision whether to play or retire. The Bucs’ door is always open. … I’m told “it was a positive conversation.” My understanding is that the #Bucs are still willing to give David ample time if necessary to make a decision on still playing the game. Additionally
column14: other teams are checking on David’s potential interest in playing elsewhere beyond Tampa Bay. Joe would be floored if David decided to play elsewhere. Especially after Bowles told the Tampa Bay pen and mic club earlier this week that David was very happy with Bowles bringing back Mike Caldwell as inside linebackers coach. As the clock ticks towards the draft — a long way away

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/jamel-dean-situation-sounds-unsettled/|Jamel Dean Situation Sounds Unsettled|Is Jamel Dean on solid footing with the Bucs as free agency looms? Bucs AC/DC-loving general manager Jason Licht was not overly enthusiastic about Dean when speaking Tuesday at the combine housed in its beehive inside the Indiana Convention Center in downtown Indianapolis. Dean is a talented corner Todd Bowles likes but Bowles also looks for takeaways from his corners
column2: which Dean rarely provides. Joe’s biggest issue with Dean is he cannot stay on the field. He’s about to turn 29. Chronically injured guys that age don’t all of a sudden get healthier. In the last four Bucs playoff games
column3: Dean either was not available or couldn’t finish three due to injury. In fact
column4: in the last two Bucs playoff games
column6: Dean couldn’t stay on the field in the fourth quarter. Not good. Given the chance to outright say Dean is secure
column7: Bucs AC/DC-loving general manager instead said Dean’s status is uncertain. (Background: The following response about Dean from Licht came immediately after Light had said the team was evaluating whether to bring back Jordan Whitehead. Roughly 24 hours later
column8: Whitehead was an ex-Bucs player.) “Another thing we are discussing internally
column9: ” Licht said of Dean’s job security. “Love Jamel. He’s done some great things for us. Been with us a long time. He hasn’t been on the field as much as we’d like. “There are some things we have to review and the whole landscape of the position
column10: what it’s like in the draft. There is no timetable on [Dean] either. We are in no rush to make that decision.” When Joe asked a follow-up question about adding a potential starting corner given that Dean is bound to miss games with injuries
column12: “That’s one position we need to add depth
column14: to.” So Dean’s not exactly on firm ground. Nor should he be. Look
column15: Joe likes Dean and thinks Dean is a decent player unlike many fans. But dang
column16: he misses games. And when the guy cannot answer the bell in the most important games of the season

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/368883/|Jon Gruden Will Be Reinstated Into Bucs’ Ring Of Honor|A great wrong has been righted. Last night
column2: it was officially announced that Team Glazer decided to reinstate the winningest coach in Bucs history
column4: the man who got the Bucs their first Super Bowl win
column5: back into the coveted team’s Ring of Honor. Well done
column6: Team Glazer. Well done! Chucky was in the Ring of Honor but his name was unceremoniously removed after personal
column7: vile if not grossly insensitive emails from Chucky were leaked. Some allegedly were directed toward Team Glazer. The emails were typed many years ago when Chucky was an ESPN analyst on “Monday Night Football” and not coaching. Joe really had a problem with the decision to remove Chucky’s name from the Ring of Honor. Were his emails despicable? Absolutely! But Joe is very much against attempts at whitewashing history. And in Joe’s mind
column8: removing Chucky’s name from the Ring of Honor was an attempt to rewrite Bucs history. Like it was an attempt to pretend Chucky never worked for the Bucs
column9: as if his coaching didn’t finally push the Bucs over the hump to win the team’s first Super Bowl. Joe is a history nut and treasures history. Joe believes all history
column11: needs to be remembered. Rather than lazily try to cancel Chucky
column12: Joe thought then and thinks now that those awful emails should be used as a teaching and learning tool. Canceling Chucky did nothing more than try to sweep an issue under a rug. How can we ever advance as a sophisticated society if we don’t learn from mistakes? Former St. Louis Cardinals play-by-play man Jack Buck once said when Mark McGwire broke Roger Maris’ then-season record of 60 home runs in 1998
column13: “Pardon me for a moment while I stand to applaud.” So pardon Joe for a moment as he applauds Team Glazer for doing the right thing and reinstating Chucky into the Bucs’ hallowed Ring of Honor.|2025-02-28 00:00:00|320|0|9|Jon Gruden|Gruden reinstated into Bucs' Ring of Honor after controversial removal.||No comments available.|{}
